usefulItems: deep-sided roasting tray (32 x 23 cm), bowl, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, 12-hole muffin tray, madeleine tray, wooden skewer, oven
title: Coq au vin blanc with polenta madeleines

ingredients.content: 4 chicken marylands, jointed, trimmed and skin on
200 g shortcut bacon rashers, trimmed and cut into pieces (2 cm)
½ tsp Chicken stock paste (see Tips)
6 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
200 g Swiss brown mushrooms, cut into quarters
20 g salted butter, plus extra for greasing
40 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)
2 tbsp gluten free flour mix (see Tips)

preparations.content: Arrange chicken pieces in a deep-sided roasting tray (32 x 23 cm), then scatter with eschalots, bacon, thyme, rosemary, salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes (190°C).
Remove chicken from oven. Add wine, stock paste and water to roasting tray and roast chicken for a further 30 minutes (190°C).
Place parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add mushrooms and butter and cook <b>5 min/Varoma//speed <b>.

Remove chicken from oven and scatter over mushroom mixture and half of the reserved parsley. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C. Roast chicken for a further 10 minutes (180°C), or until chicken is cooked. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Remove chicken from oven and skim off any excess fat. Transfer chicken into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm.
Grease a madeleine or 12-hole muffin tray and place 1 sage leaf into base of each mould. Set aside.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt <b>1 min/90°C/speed 2<b>.
Add polenta, flour mix, bicarbonate of soda, salt and pepper and mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add egg, buttermilk and reserved Parmesan and mix <b>8 sec/speed 4<b>, or until smooth.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the polenta mixture into each mould and bake for 8-10 minutes (180°C), or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of each madeleine comes out clean.
Sprinkle chicken with remaining reserved parsley and serve with Polenta madeleines.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
Do not use instant polenta for this recipe as it will cook too quickly and become gluggy.
Please refer to the Gluten free flour mix recipe on this recipe chip.
A patty pan tin can be substituted for a madeleine tin.
